displaytitle: Mao badge commemorating oil painting of Mao's trip to Anyuan
medium: 146 political badges of various shapes and sizes pinned on a T-shirt with a silkscreened image of Mao Zedong in pigtails by Zhang Hongtu
dimensions: badge: diam. 5.1 cm. (2 in.); overall: ca. 77 x ca. 90 cm. (30 5/16 x 35 7/16 in.)

titles.title: Mao badge commemorating oil painting of Mao's trip to Anyuan

texts.textentryhtml: –2009 Collection of Zhang Hongtu (Woodside, NY), by gift to the Princeton University Art Museum, 2009.

Round, 5.1 cm. diam.  Youthful silver Mao, full figure, striding across mountaintop (Anyuan), wearing traditional robe, billowing as he walks; left arm slightly in back, right arm holding folded umbrella. Background hills are rendered in + shallow relief in red; foreground that Mao walks on = rocks with foliage, in silver.
Back: clasp at 9:15 & 2:25; 2 inscriptions: 1 (above clasp): “热烈欢呼 / 毛主席去安源油画发表” ; 2 (below clasp): 中央工艺美术学院 / (in smaller characters) 革命委员会 / 1968”.

caption: Chinese, Modern period (1912–present), Mao badge commemorating oil painting of Mao's trip to Anyuan, 1968. 146 political badges of various shapes and sizes pinned on a T-shirt with a silkscreened image of Mao Zedong in pigtails by Zhang Hongtu; 5.1 cm (image). Gift of Zhang Hongtu (2009-19.81)

Gift of Zhang Hongtu (2009-19.81)
